DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior Registration Laboratory Procedure Malignant Neoplasm Eligibility Determination Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to the medical procedure regarding tumor prior to the act of enrolling on a clinical trial as a determination of the suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior Registration Laboratory Procedure Malignant Neoplasm Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure regarding tumor prior to the act of enrolling on a clinical trial as a determination of the suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior Registration Laboratory Procedure Malignant Neoplasm Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
